chunks.original_text: 华子期者，九江人也。 少好仙道，入山隐迹，采服草药，栖身林阜二十余年。 忽遇甪里先生，乃授之仙隐灵宝方，一曰河图隐存符，二曰伊雒飞龟，三曰平衡。 案合服之，日更少壮，色如少女，一日行五百里，能举千斤，一岁十易皮。 乃入潜山中，而白日升天矣。 仙人挹服五方诸天气经 华子期受甪里先生诀，乐子长书出神名。 东方青牙九气之天，其气烟如春草之始萌，其光如晖日之初隆，下有朝华之渊，上有流英之宫，室有青腰玉女，堂有太上真王。 玉女乘九山之兽，真王驾九光神龙，上导九天之气，下引九泉之流芳，养二仪以长存，护阴阳以流通，天致元精於太极，地保山岳於句芒，神运虚于寂台，人养五藏於唇锋。 所以营溉之者无极，存之者不终。 於是回万劫而更始，却衰朽而童蒙。 尔乃鹏奏九遐，上登玄洞，仰寻太真之灵官，与仙僚而为宗。 大哉灵宝青牙，长存由九气之功。 南方朱丹三气之天，其气烟如绛云之苞白日，其光如玄玉之映流渊，下有赤泉之泓池，上有长生之朱宫，室有太丹玉女，居于太阳三山之上。 堂有元气丈人，驾三角之麟，上导泰清玄元之灵化，下和三气之陶馆，令万物之永存，运天精於南夏，养人精於丹唇。 所以采之者无终，营之者永存。 於是却凋老而反婴，还枯朽而茂繁，攘秋霜之落叶，反光华於万春。 尔乃龙盻虚空，鸾翔云端，忽纵心而豁虑，无尘埃之是恋。 大哉灵宝朱丹，长生由三气之勋。 中央元洞大帝之山，上出黄气，下治地门，其气烟如云，径蒸九天，元精往来，气直如弦，上通太上无极，下生神灵。 其光如飞景之罗朝日，其明如朗月之照幽城，内有玄膺九窗之阙，外有醴泉玉浆之渊，真人名曰子丹，天中号黄庭戊己天仓玉女，却死主养生宫，号曰大帝。 总御九天之真，乘地轴之辇，从六甲六丁，迁赏道功，诛伐魔精，上导自然之和，下极五土之灵，天地守以不亏，阴阳用兹不倾，天气柔顺而无极，人漱唇齿以不零。 於是抗虞渊之日，反朝霞之始明，回惛朽之枯叟，革休灭之方清，光颜烨然而还初，神气充实以流盈。 尔乃虬步八域，上升云路，超群萃以凌眄，挹天气以自度，友真仙於太微，后三光而告暮。 大哉灵宝黄庭，长生由一气之固。 西方明石七气之天，其气烟如明月之落於景云，其光如幽夜之睹於明珠，白龙衔芝草而启腾，灵真降素醴而沾濡，斯乃七天之灵泽，上真之琼腴，气甘和而谵妙，虽鼎味而不殊。 下有玉泉之长河，上有流英之楼宇，室有太上素女，堂有元气大夫。 乘崩山之狞虎，骋云辇於虚无，上导洪精於七天，下和众生於云衢，抱云露於皓芝，饮灵液於龙须，叩天池而鸣鼓，收甘津於舌端。 所以存之者莫坠，为之者永居，是以却素发而玄黑，反枯朽而婴孩。 尔乃凤舞景汉，朗啸清虚，枕云岫而炼神，养精和於太初，致真人而为友，安知荣辱之所如。 大哉灵宝明石，长生由七气之娱。 北方玄滋五气之天，其气烟如飘风之激於炎林，其光如流星之堕於洪波，煎玉饴於龙鼎，汲玄气於天湖。 下有长生之渊，中有太上之家，室有夜光玉女，服云林之翠罗，乘灵虬以启真，驾鹿辇於天河，上导五常之流气，下拯万生之众，和护二仪而不倾，保群命以永遐，天致元精於太玄，真人养三府於齿牙。
chunks.translated_text:
Hua Ziqiu, a native of Jiujiang, was devoted to the Way of immortals from his youth. He entered the mountains to conceal his traces, gathering and consuming herbs, dwelling among the forests and hills for over twenty years. One day, he encountered Master Luli, who bestowed upon him the *Divine Concealment and Numinous Treasure Methods*: first, the *Hidden River Chart Talisman*; second, the *Flying Turtle of Yi and Luo*; and third, the *Balance of Equilibrium*. Upon verifying and practicing them, he grew younger with each passing day, his complexion like that of a maiden. In a single day, he could travel five hundred *li* and lift a thousand *jin*; in a year, he shed his skin ten times. He then entered Mount Qian, ascending to heaven in broad daylight.

The *Scripture of Absorbing the Qi of the Five Directions and All Heavens*:
Hua Ziqiu received the oral instructions of Master Luli, and Le Zichang’s writings revealed the names of the spirits.

**The Azure Tooth Heaven of the Nine Qi of the East**—its qi like mist rising as spring grass first sprouts, its radiance like the sun’s first glow at dawn. Below lies the Abyss of Morning Blossoms; above, the Palace of Flowing Splendor. Within its chambers dwell the Jade-Maiden of the Azure Waist; in its halls, the True King of the Supreme. The Jade-Maiden rides the beast of the Nine Mountains; the True King drives a nine-light divine dragon. Above, they guide the qi of the Nine Heavens; below, they draw the fragrant streams of the Nine Springs. They nurture the Two Modes to endure, safeguard Yin and Yang to flow unimpeded. Heaven bestows primordial essence upon the Great Ultimate; Earth preserves the mountains and hills under Goumang. Spirits move in emptiness upon the Terrace of Stillness; humans cultivate the Five Viscera at the edge of their lips. Thus, those who cultivate it know no bounds; those who preserve it never perish. Thereby, they reverse the myriad kalpas to renew, casting off decay to return to youth. Then, like the roc soaring to the nine distances, they ascend the Dark Cavern, gazing upward to seek the numinous halls of the Supreme Perfected, joining the immortals as their kin. Great is the *Azure Tooth Numinous Treasure*—long life arises from the merit of the Nine Qi.

**The Vermilion Cinnabar Heaven of the Three Qi of the South**—its qi like crimson clouds veiling the white sun, its radiance like dark jade reflecting a flowing abyss. Below lies the Crimson Spring’s deep pool; above, the Vermilion Palace of Longevity. Within its chambers dwells the Jade-Maiden of Great Cinnabar, residing upon the Three Mountains of the Grand Yang. In its halls sits the Venerable One of Primordial Qi, riding a three-horned unicorn. Above, he guides the numinous transformations of the Supreme Clarity and Primordial Mystery; below, he harmonizes the Three Qi in the kiln of creation, ensuring the eternal endurance of the myriad things. He circulates celestial essence in the southern summer, nurturing human essence at the cinnabar lips. Thus, those who refine it never end; those who cultivate it endure forever. Thereby, they cast off withered age to return to infancy, restore decay to flourishing abundance, dispel autumn frost’s falling leaves, and revive radiant splendor for ten thousand springs. Then, like the dragon gazing into the void and the simurgh soaring amid clouds, they suddenly release the heart and clear the mind, free from the dust of worldly attachments. Great is the *Vermilion Cinnabar Numinous Treasure*—immortality arises from the merit of the Three Qi.

**The Central Mountain of the Great Emperor of the Primordial Cavern**—above, yellow qi rises; below, it governs the Gate of Earth. Its qi, like clouds, steams straight through the Nine Heavens; primordial essence flows back and forth, its qi straight as a bowstring. Above, it connects to the Supreme and Boundless; below, it generates divine spirits. Its radiance is like flying light weaving through the morning sun; its brilliance like the bright moon illuminating a secluded city. Within lies the Nine-Windowed Gate of the Dark Breast; without, the Abyss of Sweet Springs and Jade Nectar. The Perfected One is named Zidan; in heaven, he is called the Jade Maiden of the Yellow Court, the Heavenly Granary of Wu and Ji. He presides over the Palace of Nurturing Life, known as the Great Emperor. He governs the Perfected of the Nine Heavens, riding the chariot of Earth’s axis, accompanied by the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits. He rewards the merits of the Dao, punishes demonic essences, above guiding the harmony of spontaneity, below extending to the numinous spirits of the Five Lands. Heaven and Earth are preserved without loss; Yin and Yang are balanced without tilting. Heaven’s qi is gentle and boundless; humans rinse their lips and teeth to prevent decay. Thereby, they resist the sun of Yu Yuan, restore the first light of dawn, reverse the withered old man’s decline, and transform extinction into purity. Their luminous countenance shines anew; their spirit and qi overflow with abundance. Then, like the dragon pacing the eight realms, they ascend the cloud paths, surpassing the multitudes with a glance, drawing in heavenly qi to sustain themselves. They befriend the Perfected Immortals in the Grand Tenuity, following the Three Luminaries to announce the dusk. Great is the *Yellow Court Numinous Treasure*—immortality arises from the solidity of the One Qi.

**The Bright Stone Heaven of the Seven Qi of the West**—its qi like the bright moon descending upon rosy clouds, its radiance like beholding a luminous pearl in the deep night. White dragons hold magic mushrooms in their jaws to ascend; divine immortals descend with pure nectar to moisten and nourish. This is the numinous essence of the Seven Heavens, the celestial sustenance of the Supreme Perfected—its qi sweet and harmonious, subtle and wondrous, surpassing even the finest alchemical elixirs. Below lies the Long River of Jade Springs; above, the towering mansions of Flowing Splendor. Within its chambers dwell the Supreme Jade-Maidens of Purity; in its halls, the Great Man of Primordial Qi. They ride fierce tigers of collapsing mountains, driving cloud chariots through the void. Above, they guide the vast essence of the Seven Heavens; below, they harmonize all beings in the cloud thoroughfares. They embrace cloud dew upon white mushrooms, drink divine liquid from dragon’s whiskers, strike the Heavenly Pool to sound the drum, and gather sweet essence upon their tongues. Thus, those who preserve it never fall; those who practice it dwell forever. Thereby, they reverse white hair to dark, restore decay to infancy. Then, like the phoenix dancing in the Milky Way, they chant clear and empty hymns, resting upon cloud peaks to refine the spirit, nurturing essence and harmony in the Great Beginning. They befriend the Perfected Ones, heedless of honor or disgrace. Great is the *Bright Stone Numinous Treasure*—immortality arises from the joy of the Seven Qi.

**The Dark Moisture Heaven of the Five Qi of the North**—its qi like whirlwinds stirring in fiery forests, its radiance like meteors plunging into vast waves. Jade syrup is simmered in dragon cauldrons; dark qi is drawn from the Heavenly Lake. Below lies the Abyss of Longevity; within, the home of the Supreme. In its chambers dwell the Night-Glow Jade-Maidens, clad in emerald silk of cloud groves, riding divine dragons to reveal the Perfected, driving deer chariots upon the Heavenly River. Above, they guide the flowing qi of the Five Constants; below, they rescue the multitudes of living beings. They harmonize and protect the Two Modes without tilting, safeguarding all lives for eternal ages. Heaven bestows primordial essence upon the Supreme Mystery; the Perfected nurture the Three Palaces at the teeth and jaws. Thus, those who preserve it never perish; those who cultivate it endure forever. Thereby, they cast off withered age to return to youth, restore decay to flourishing vitality. Then, like the dragon gazing into the void, they soar amid the clouds, suddenly freeing the heart and releasing worldly cares. Great is the *Dark Moisture Numinous Treasure*—immortality arises from the merit of the Five Qi.

chunks.original_text: 所以为之者长存，用之者寿多，漱神津於元首，合淳气而弗华。 於是回阳光之西倾，还昊日於东陵，却衰枯之绝烟，反童稚而方升。 尔乃鸿鼓云池，勃郁而龙腾，友真人以论好，与灵仙而高登，其德洪矣，焉有能胜。 大哉灵宝玄滋，长生由五气之兴。 灵宝五帝官将号 夏禹撰出天文中字，会稽南山之阳所演集。 东方灵威仰，号曰苍帝，其神甲乙，服色尚青，驾苍龙，建青旗，气为木，星为岁，从群神九十万人，上和春气，下生万物。 南方赤飘弩，号曰赤帝，其神丙丁，服色尚赤，驾赤龙，建朱旗，气为火，星为荧惑，从群神三十万人，上和夏气，下长万物。 中央含枢纽，号曰黄帝，其神戊己，服色尚黄，驾黄龙，建黄旗，气为土，星为镇，从群神十二万人，下和土气，上戴九天。 西方曜魄宝，号曰白帝，其神庚辛，服色尚白，驾白龙，建素旗，气为金，星为太白，从群神七十万人，上和秋气，下收万物。 北方隐侯局，号曰黑帝，其神壬癸，服色尚玄，驾黑龙，建皂旗，气为水，星为辰，从群神五十万人，上和冬气，下藏万物。 灵宝要诀 霍林仙人授乐子长，隐於劳盛山之阴。 道士入山采药，采八石灵芝合丹液，及隐身林岫以却众精，诸无灵宝五符者，神药沈匿，八石隐形，芝英藏光，所学不成，邪气试犯，鬼怪振惊矣。 诸见魍魉之妖，以灵符指之，即自消灭。 若山精恐胁，亦登摧折，千变万化唯其所恣也。 道士不可妄行非道，非道之法，当远之也。 子之慎至矣。 遵大法者，即便收对群神，摄召万灵，斩截凶魔，佩五文於肘间，招仙真于九霄，秘灵宝於五方，非同契而永幽。 斯乃上皇之玄教，文命藏之於东苗，誓万劫而一宣，然后睹天书之弗凋。 闭口则福微而着，泄漏则祸重而枭，是以帝喾之至亲，不与嚣子於唐尧。 太清五始法 行东方之道，木肝王，心为上相。 常以立春、春分入靖室，各首其外，暝目存其内，思肝气正青，赤神侍之，黄气养之。 随身正青，上与天通，太清元气，下入身中，勾芒来至，老君主之。 王者行之，则麒麟至，翔凤发，而万物华茂，岁星顺度，精通太微，南夷服，灵瑞至。 东方仁，木王，火相，土死，金囚，水休，囚死当养子为父报仇。 行南方之道，火心王，脾为上相。 常以立夏、夏至入靖室，各首其卧，瞑 目存神，内思心气正赤如日，黄神侍之，白气养之，随身正赤，上与天通，太清元气，下入身中，祝融来至，太一主之。 王者行之，凤凰来翔，甘露降，景风扇，万物育长，天垂景星，荧惑顺常，萐莆生，嘉禾成，西夷服，中国丰。 南方礼，火王，土相，金死，水囚，木休，囚死当养子为父报仇。 行西方之道，金肺王，肾为上相，常以立秋、秋分入靖室，各首其卧，暝目存神，内思肺气正白，黑神侍之，青气养之，随身正白，上与天通，太清元气，下入身中，蓐收来至，太和主之。 王者行之，白虎见仁，被厌子，蛊毒藏形，清风新雨，五谷熟成，万机得序，玉衡顺平，天马来下，太白顺行，东夷服，鸾鸟至。 西方义，金王，水相，木死，火囚，土休，囚死当养子为父报仇。 行北方之道，水肾王，肝为上相，常以立冬、冬至入靖室，各首其卧，暝目存神，内思念肾气正黑，元气漂漂，如山出云，浮行着天，上与天通，太清元气，下入身中，一身尽热，赤气养之，玄黄五色，玄冥来至，道君主之。

Thus, those who enact it endure forever; those who employ it enjoy long life. They rinse the divine fluid in the primal head, merging with the pure qi without dissipation. Thereupon, they turn back the westward-sinking yang radiance, returning the vast sun to the eastern heights, dispelling the withered and desiccated to their final breath, and reversing decay to ascend once more in youthful vigor.

Then, with the resonant drum of the cloud pool, the pent-up qi surges forth in dragon-like ascent. They befriend the Perfected to discourse on affinity, ascending high with the numinous immortals—so vast is their virtue that none can surpass it. Great is the *Numinous Treasure Dark Moisture*—immortality arises from the flourishing of the Five Qi.

**The Numinous Treasure Five Thearchs’ Official Generals**
These titles were compiled by Yu of Xia from celestial script, revealed on the southern slopes of Mount Kuaiji. They are as follows:

The **Eastern Thearch, Spirit Awe-Loft**, styled the Azure Thearch. His spirit governs *jia-yi*, his raiment favors azure, he rides a green dragon, and bears a cyan banner. His qi is Wood, his star is Jupiter. He commands a host of ninety myriad spirits, harmonizing the spring qi above and engendering the ten thousand things below.

The **Southern Thearch, Crimson Whirlwind**, styled the Vermilion Thearch. His spirit governs *bing-ding*, his raiment favors crimson, he rides a red dragon, and bears a vermilion banner. His qi is Fire, his star is Mars. He commands a host of thirty myriad spirits, harmonizing the summer qi above and nurturing the ten thousand things below.

The **Central Thearch, Pivot-Containing**, styled the Yellow Thearch. His spirit governs *wu-ji*, his raiment favors yellow, he rides a yellow dragon, and bears a golden banner. His qi is Earth, his star is Saturn. He commands a host of twelve myriad spirits, harmonizing the earth qi below and bearing the Nine Heavens above.

The **Western Thearch, Radiant Soul-Treasure**, styled the White Thearch. His spirit governs *geng-xin*, his raiment favors white, he rides a white dragon, and bears a plain banner. His qi is Metal, his star is Venus. He commands a host of seventy myriad spirits, harmonizing the autumn qi above and gathering the ten thousand things below.

The **Northern Thearch, Hidden Marquis**, styled the Black Thearch. His spirit governs *ren-gui*, his raiment favors black, he rides a black dragon, and bears a sable banner. His qi is Water, his star is Mercury. He commands a host of fifty myriad spirits, harmonizing the winter qi above and concealing the ten thousand things below.

**Essential Instructions of the Numinous Treasure**
Transmitted by the Immortal of Huolin to Le Zichang, concealed on the northern slopes of Mount Laoshen.

When Daoists enter the mountains to gather herbs, they must collect the Eight Stone Numinous Fungi to concoct the elixir, and conceal themselves in the forest crags to repel all spirits. Those without the Five Numinous Treasure Talismans will find divine medicines sinking into concealment, the Eight Stones vanishing in form, the radiance of fungal blossoms hidden, their studies unfulfilled. Malevolent qi will test and assail them, ghosts and demons will stir in alarm.

When encountering the specters of *wangliang*, point the talisman at them, and they will dissolve of themselves. If mountain spirits seek to intimidate, they too will be shattered and broken. Against the thousand transformations and myriad shifts, the talisman holds absolute dominion.

Daoists must not recklessly practice heterodox ways—such methods should be shunned. Your caution is most thorough.

Those who uphold the Great Method will immediately summon and command the host of spirits, gather and call forth the ten thousand numina, sever and destroy baleful demons. Wearing the Five Scripts at the elbow, they summon the transcendents and perfected from the Nine Empyreans, conceal the Numinous Treasure in the Five Directions, and—unless bound by covenant—remain forever secluded. This is the arcane teaching of the Supreme Thearch, hidden by Yu the Great in the eastern wilds. Sworn to be revealed but once in ten thousand kalpas, only then may one behold the celestial writ that never fades.

To seal the mouth is to manifest blessings in clarity; to leak secrets is to invite calamity and decapitation. Thus, even Di Ku’s closest kin were not entrusted with the clamor of Yao’s son.

**The Five Beginnings Method of the Grand Purity**
To practice the Way of the East: Wood governs the liver, with the heart as its chief minister. Regularly enter the quiet chamber at *Lichun* and the spring equinox, facing outward in repose. With eyes closed, inwardly visualize the liver’s qi as true azure, attended by a vermilion spirit and nurtured by yellow qi. Align the body with true azure, ascending to commune with Heaven. The primordial qi of the Grand Purity descends into the body, where Gou Mang arrives, presided over by Lord Lao.

When rulers practice this, qilin appear, soaring phoenixes take flight, and the ten thousand things flourish in luxuriance. Jupiter follows its proper course, essence permeates the Grand Tenuity, the southern barbarians submit, and numinous portents arrive. The East embodies benevolence: Wood is sovereign, Fire is minister, Earth is dead, Metal is imprisoned, Water is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

To practice the Way of the South: Fire governs the heart, with the spleen as its chief minister. Regularly enter the quiet chamber at *Lixia* and the summer solstice, facing in repose. With eyes closed, inwardly visualize the heart’s qi as true crimson, like the sun, attended by a yellow spirit and nurtured by white qi. Align the body with true crimson, ascending to commune with Heaven. The primordial qi of the Grand Purity descends into the body, where Zhu Rong arrives, presided over by the Grand Unity.

When rulers practice this, phoenixes soar, sweet dew descends, balmy winds fan the land, and the ten thousand things grow and thrive. Heaven suspends auspicious stars, Mars follows its constant path, *shapu* grasses sprout, fine grains ripen, the western barbarians submit, and the Central Kingdom prospers. The South embodies propriety: Fire is sovereign, Earth is minister, Metal is dead, Water is imprisoned, Wood is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

To practice the Way of the West: Metal governs the lungs, with the kidneys as its chief minister. Regularly enter the quiet chamber at *Liqiu* and the autumn equinox, facing in repose. With eyes closed, inwardly visualize the lungs’ qi as true white, attended by a black spirit and nurtured by azure qi. Align the body with true white, ascending to commune with Heaven. The primordial qi of the Grand Purity descends into the body, where Ru Shou arrives, presided over by the Grand Harmony.

When rulers practice this, the White Tiger appears in benevolence, baleful influences are suppressed, poisons conceal their forms, crisp winds and fresh rains arrive, the five grains ripen, the myriad affairs fall into order, the Jade Balance levels, celestial horses descend, Venus follows its path, the eastern barbarians submit, and simurghs alight. The West embodies righteousness: Metal is sovereign, Water is minister, Wood is dead, Fire is imprisoned, Earth is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

To practice the Way of the North: Water governs the kidneys, with the liver as its chief minister. Regularly enter the quiet chamber at *Lidong* and the winter solstice, facing in repose. With eyes closed, inwardly visualize the kidneys’ qi as true black, the primordial qi billowing like mountains exhaling clouds, floating and ascending to Heaven. Align the body to commune with Heaven. The primordial qi of the Grand Purity descends into the body, filling it with warmth, nurtured by crimson qi and the five colors of dark yellow. Xuan Ming arrives, presided over by the Lord of the Dao.

When rulers practice this, the ten thousand mechanisms attain harmony, the celestial writ never fades, and the northern barbarians submit. The North embodies wisdom: Water is sovereign, Wood is minister, Fire is dead, Earth is imprisoned, Metal is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

chunks.original_text: 王者行之，万水流通，神龟鲜文，理风戢雨，万物闭藏，休养黄泉，勿妄夭伤，辰星顺度，文曜不绝，南夷服，黑丹出。 北方智，水王，木相，火死，土囚，金休，囚死当养子为父报仇。 行中央戊己之道，土脾王，肺为上相，六月土王日入靖室，正向南坐，暝目存神，内思脾气正黄，白气侍之，黑气养之，随身正黄，上与天通，太清元气，下入身中，正黄浑如鸡子，澹泊无为，万物自理，禺强来至，道君主之。 王者行之，则八方被化，百神并营，地吐醴泉，天垂景星，黄龙见升，精芝英茂，威僖生，甘露降，禾稼成，四夷降伏，天下太平。 中央戊己信，土王，金相，水死，木囚，火休，囚死当养子为父报仇。 食日月精之道 食日之精，可以长生。 常以月一日、三日、五日、七日、九日、十五日，日初出时，披发向日，暝目念心中有小童子，绛衣文彩，五色熠耀正赤。 两手以摩面，下至心，十二反为之，日精正赤黄气，来在目前，入口中，咽之二九，以手摩送之。 咒曰： 日君元阳，与我合德，俱养绛宫中小童子。 须臾念下至丹田中止，令人长生。 食月之精，以养肾根，白发复黑。 常以夜半，思肾间白气，周行身中，上至脑户，下至两足心。 自然之道，易致难行。 常以月十五日，向月咒曰： 月君元阴，与我合德，俱养丹田中小童子。 因暝目自念，月白黄精气，来在目前，入口中，咽之三七而止，以手摩送之，下至丹田中止。 中黄道君曰：天生万物，人为贵。 人一身形，包含天地，日月北斗，璇玑玉衡，五岳四渎，山川河海，风伯雨师，灵星社稷，麒麟凤凰，龙虎玄武，五谷桑麻，六畜牛马，鸟兽鱼鳌龟鼉，竹木百草，无所不法也。 亦立天子，置三公九卿、二十七大夫、八十一元士。 亦布九州、百二十郡、千二百县、万八千乡、三万六千亭、十八万堠。 亦有宫阙、家宅、门户、井灶、釜甑、粳粮黍稷，诸神可饮食者，人而知之，即可长生也。 人头圆象天，足方法地，发为星辰，目为日月，眉为北斗，耳为社稷，鼻为丘山，口为江河，齿为玉石，四肢为四时。 五脏法五行，亦为五帝，亦为五曹，上为五星，下为五岳，内为五王，外为五德，升为五云，化为五龙。 五脏者，谓肺、心、肝、脾、肾也。 六腑者，胆为肝腑，胃为脾腑，大肠为肺腑，小肠为心腑，膀胱为肾腑，脐为都乡腑。 胆为天子大道君，脾为皇后贵女，心为太尉公，左肾为司徒公，右肾为司空公。 八卦神八者，并脐太一，为九卿。 十二环楼神十二人，脾中谏议大夫十二人，并三膲神三人，合二十七大夫。 四肢神为八十一元士，上元气为冠盖使者，下元气为大鸿胪。 上部九变，中部九孔，下部九名，法九州也。 三公府、九卿府、二十七大夫府、八十一元士府，合为百二十府。 府内为五曹，外为五官，合为十官，为千二百县。 中神万八千，为万八千乡。 上神三万六千，为三万六千亭。 亭有五堠，为十八万堠。 又肺为玉堂宫尚书府，心为绛宫元阳府，肝为青阳宫兰台府，胆为紫微宫无极府，脾为中宫太素府，肾为幽昌宫太和府。 子欲为道，长生不死，当先存其神，养其根，行其气，呼其名。 头发之神七人，字寻长。 项上神三人，东王父。

When rulers practice this, the ten thousand waters flow unimpeded, the divine tortoise bears fresh patterns, governing winds still the rains, and the myriad things close and store away, resting and nurturing in the Yellow Springs. Do not recklessly cut short or harm them. The Morning Star moves in accord with its measure, the literary luminaries never cease, the southern barbarians submit, and black cinnabar emerges.

The North embodies wisdom: Water is sovereign, Wood is minister, Fire is dead, Earth is imprisoned, Metal is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

To practice the Way of the Central Palace of *Wu* and *Ji*, the Spleen-Earth is sovereign, the Lungs are chief minister. On the day when Earth reigns in the sixth month, enter the quiet chamber, sit facing due south, close the eyes, and inwardly visualize the spirit. Within, contemplate the spleen’s qi as true yellow, attended by white qi and nurtured by black qi, the body suffused with true yellow, ascending to commune with Heaven. The primordial qi of the Grand Purity descends into the body, a pure yellow like a chicken’s egg, serene and without action, so the myriad things govern themselves. *Yuqiang* arrives, presided over by the Lord of the Dao.

When rulers practice this, the eight directions are transformed, the hundred spirits all attend, the earth yields sweet springs, Heaven hangs auspicious stars, the yellow dragon appears and ascends, essence-mushrooms flourish, *Weixi* is born, sweet dew descends, crops ripen, the four barbarians submit, and the world attains great peace.

The Central Palace of *Wu* and *Ji* embodies trust: Earth is sovereign, Metal is minister, Water is dead, Wood is imprisoned, Fire is at rest. When the imprisoned and dead arise, one should raise a son to avenge the father.

**The Way of Ingesting the Essence of the Sun and Moon**

To ingest the sun’s essence is to attain longevity. Regularly on the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and fifteenth days of the lunar month, at sunrise, face the sun with hair unbound, close the eyes, and visualize within the heart a small youth clad in crimson robes, resplendent with five-colored radiance, a true red. Rub the hands over the face, descending to the heart, repeating this twelve times. The sun’s essence, a true red-yellow qi, appears before the eyes, enters the mouth, and is swallowed thirty-six times, guided downward with the hands. Recite the incantation:

*"Sun Lord, Primordial Yang, unite your virtue with mine, together nurturing the small youth within the Crimson Palace."*

After a moment, guide the visualization down to the Cinnabar Field, where it remains, granting long life.

To ingest the moon’s essence is to nourish the root of the kidneys, restoring white hair to black. Regularly at midnight, visualize white qi within the kidneys circulating throughout the body, ascending to the brain’s gate and descending to the soles of the feet. This is the natural Way—easy to attain, difficult to practice.

Regularly on the fifteenth day of the lunar month, face the moon and recite the incantation:

*"Moon Lord, Primordial Yin, unite your virtue with mine, together nurturing the small youth within the Cinnabar Field."*

Then close the eyes and inwardly visualize the moon’s white-yellow essence appearing before the eyes, entering the mouth, and being swallowed twenty-one times, guided downward with the hands until it rests in the Cinnabar Field.

The Central Yellow Lord of the Dao says: Heaven gives birth to the myriad things, and humans are the most noble. The human body encompasses Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the Northern Dipper, the jade armillary sphere, the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, mountains and rivers, seas and streams, the Wind Earl and Rain Master, the spirit stars and altars of soil and grain, the qilin and phoenix, the dragon and tiger, the Dark Warrior, the five grains and hemp, the six livestock—oxen and horses—birds and beasts, fish and soft-shelled turtles, tortoises and alligators, bamboo and trees, the hundred grasses—nothing it does not model.

Thus, the Son of Heaven is established, with the Three Dukes, Nine Ministers, Twenty-Seven Grand Masters, and Eighty-One Principal Officers. The nine provinces are divided into one hundred twenty commanderies, one thousand two hundred counties, eighteen thousand townships, thirty-six thousand wards, and one hundred eighty thousand outposts. There are palaces and residences, gates and doors, wells and hearths, cauldrons and steamers, rice and millet—all the spirits that may be nourished. When humans understand this, they may attain long life.

The human head is round, modeling Heaven; the feet are square, modeling Earth. The hair is the stars, the eyes are the sun and moon, the brows are the Northern Dipper, the ears are the altars of soil and grain, the nose is the hills and mountains, the mouth is the rivers and streams, the teeth are jade and stone, the four limbs are the four seasons. The five viscera model the Five Phases, the Five Thearchs, the Five Offices, the Five Stars above, the Five Peaks below, the Five Kings within, the Five Virtues without, ascending as the Five Clouds, transforming into the Five Dragons.

The five viscera are the lungs, heart, liver, spleen, and kidneys. The six bowels are: the gallbladder as the liver’s bowel, the stomach as the spleen’s bowel, the large intestine as the lung’s bowel, the small intestine as the heart’s bowel, the bladder as the kidney’s bowel, and the navel as the capital’s bowel.

The gallbladder is the Celestial Thearch, the Great Lord of the Dao; the spleen is the Empress, the Noble Lady; the heart is the Grand Commandant; the left kidney is the Minister of Education; the right kidney is the Minister of Works. The eight trigrams’ spirits, together with the Great One of the navel, form the Nine Ministers. The twelve encircling tower spirits, the twelve Remonstrating Gentlemen within the spleen, and the three *jiao* spirits together form the Twenty-Seven Grand Masters. The spirits of the four limbs are the Eighty-One Principal Officers. The upper primordial qi is the Crowned Envoy; the lower primordial qi is the Grand Herald.

The upper body has nine transformations, the middle body has nine orifices, the lower body has nine names—modeling the nine provinces. The Three Dukes’ offices, the Nine Ministers’ offices, the Twenty-Seven Grand Masters’ offices, and the Eighty-One Principal Officers’ offices together form one hundred twenty offices. Within the offices are the Five Offices; without are the Five Directors, together forming the Ten Directors, modeling the one thousand two hundred counties. The central spirits, eighteen thousand in number, model the eighteen thousand townships. The upper spirits, thirty-six thousand in number, model the thirty-six thousand wards. Each ward has five outposts, modeling the one hundred eighty thousand outposts.

Moreover, the lungs are the Jade Hall Palace and the Ministry of Works; the heart is the Crimson Palace and the Palace of Primordial Yang; the liver is the Azure Yang Palace and the Orchid Terrace; the gallbladder is the Purple Tenuity Palace and the Limitless Palace; the spleen is the Central Palace and the Palace of Grand Simplicity; the kidneys are the Dark Prosperity Palace and the Palace of Grand Harmony.

If one desires the Dao, to attain long life and avoid death, one must first visualize the spirits, nurture their roots, circulate their qi, and invoke their names. The spirits of the hair are seven in number, named *Xunchang*. The spirits of the nape are three in number, the Eastern King Father.

chunks.original_text: 脑户中神南极君，字元先。 眉间神天灵君。 两耳神四人，字娇女。 两目神六人，字英明。 鼻中神，字通卢。 口神，字丹珠。 舌神，字丹黄。 齿神三十六人，字卫士。 喉中神，字虎贲。 两眉神，字爵神。 两手神，字魄阴。 肺神，字鸿鸿。 心神，字呴呴。 肝神，字临临。 胆神，字获获。 胃神，字沮沮。 脾神，字裨裨。 两肾神，字漂漂。 脐中神，字玉灵子。 丹田中神，字藏精。 大肠神，字沌沌。 小肠神，字梁梁。 阴神，字穷英。 女人神，字丹精。 两体神，字阴阴。 两膝神，字膒公。 两胫神，字随孔子。 两足神，字柱天力士。 子暝欲卧，从上三呼之，竟乃止。 若体有疾痛处，皆随痛所，九呼其名，令神治之。 正卧瞑目，存其神，所疾立愈。 月望朔、分至之日夕，皆存神内视，召呼体上神名，使令拘魂制魄。 真人曰：子欲登仙，当召身神。 中黄老君曰：子既知身藏之神名，又当知天地父母赤子之家，五城十二楼真人，秘之於太清玄和之府，丛霄之观，非有仙录者，不见其篇矣。 甪里先生口传之诀於华子期。 有欲知天地父母赤子，三一也。 天一在华盖下，人一在斗户，地一在日月所游。 三一煌煌如明珠，子不守之，生复何求。 又地一在日月所游，人一在斗户，天一在华盖下，元气翩翩相引也。 神龟在中正颇俄，子欲得之当问我。 一之所在安在兹，不但守雄复守雌。 一在无形甚难知，子不知一万事失。 大如鸡子黄，其色如甘橘，出为半，入为一，子能守之万事毕。 三一者，身上之三宫也。 头、心、脐，谓之三宫也。 既已知天地父母赤子之家，五城十二楼真人，须当知服神丹金液、太阳流珠太一，必为三天宫人。 子不服此三元，虚自苦耳。 第一先存五兽者，青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武是也，中央黄麟。 此五兽忽变为山林，其四方林外，有仙人虎贲羽林郎，面各八人，存之广狭随意，可隐万人。 第二当召身中神，从头至足，存其神，养其根，行其气，呼其名，必得长生神仙。 第三守地一，名曰丹田，皓白如云，五色玄黄，道母所居，溺水胞中。 第四守人一，名曰绛宫，南极太一，赤子小童，右月左日，魂魄合并。 第五守天一，名曰紫宫，大如混鸡子，九色玄黄，交结星历，身上纪纲。 第六食神丹，太阳之精。 常以月一日始七之生，三五七九及九月半甲子、丙午日为之。 入室暝目，存日精赤气，下入口中，而咽之八十一气。 真人曰：食日之精，与天地相倾。 第七食金液，玄水之精。 常月十五日时加夜半，入室暝目，存月精正白，下入口中，而咽之四十九气。 真人曰：食月之精，是故长生。 第八食星玄气来下，青白丹黄。 常用有星夕初夜之时，入室瞑目，春存岁星之精青气，下入口中，而咽之九十气止； 夏存荧惑之精赤气，下入口中，而咽之三十气止； 秋存太白星之精白气，下入口中，而咽之七十气止； 冬存辰星之精黑气，下入口中，而咽之五十气止； 四季之月二日，存镇星之精黄气，下入口中，十二咽之止。 四季月，十二月、三月、六月、九月是也。 用月二日为之，内视精心，自见其气。 真人曰：食星之气，与天相暨。 第九行太极紫云弥天，升降上下，混沌自然。 是谓八节之日，入室暝目内视，存泥丸中紫气出上升天，绛宫中赤气出上升天，丹田中黄气出上升天。

Within the brain’s gate resides the Southern Culmen Lord, styled *Yuanxian*. Between the brows dwells the Heavenly Numinous Lord. The two ears each house four spirits, styled *Jiaonü*. The two eyes each contain six spirits, styled *Yingming*. The spirit within the nose is styled *Tonglu*. The spirit of the mouth is styled *Danzhu*. The spirit of the tongue is styled *Danhuang*. The spirits of the teeth number thirty-six, styled *Weishi*. The spirit within the throat is styled *Huben*. The spirits of the two eyebrows are styled *Jueshen*. The spirits of the two hands are styled *Poyin*. The spirit of the lungs is styled *Honghong*. The spirit of the heart is styled *Xuxu*. The spirit of the liver is styled *Linlin*. The spirit of the gallbladder is styled *Huohuo*. The spirit of the stomach is styled *Juju*. The spirit of the spleen is styled *Pipi*. The spirits of the two kidneys are styled *Piaopiao*. The spirit within the navel is styled *Yulingzi*. The spirit of the Cinnabar Field is styled *Cangjing*. The spirit of the large intestine is styled *Dundun*. The spirit of the small intestine is styled *Liangliang*. The spirit of the yin is styled *Qiongying*. The spirit of a woman is styled *Danjing*. The spirits of the two limbs are styled *Yinyin*. The spirits of the two knees are styled *Ougong*. The spirits of the two shanks are styled *Suikongzi*. The spirits of the two feet are styled *Zhutian Lishi*.

When you close your eyes to sleep, call out to them three times from the top downward, and then cease. If any part of the body suffers pain, wherever the pain is, call out the name of the spirit there nine times, and bid it heal the affliction. Lie flat, close your eyes, visualize the spirit, and the ailment will immediately be cured. On the evenings of the full moon, new moon, equinoxes, and solstices, visualize the spirits within, summon and call out the names of the spirits upon the body, and command them to restrain the hun and po.

The Perfected One says: If you desire to ascend as an immortal, you must summon the spirits of the body. The Central Yellow Elder Lord says: Once you know the names of the spirits dwelling within the body, you should also know the abode of the Heavenly and Earthly Parents and the Red Child, the Perfected Ones of the Five Cities and Twelve Towers. These are concealed within the Grand Clarity’s Palace of Mysterious Harmony and the Towering Clouds Observatory. Those without immortal records shall not behold these writings. The Master of Luli transmitted the oral instructions to Hua Ziq.

If you wish to know the Heavenly and Earthly Parents and the Red Child, they are the Three Ones. The Heavenly One resides beneath the Canopy of Flowers; the Human One, within the Dipper’s Gate; the Earthly One, where the sun and moon wander. The Three Ones gleam like radiant pearls. If you do not guard them, what else is there to seek in life? Moreover, the Earthly One wanders where the sun and moon roam; the Human One dwells within the Dipper’s Gate; the Heavenly One resides beneath the Canopy of Flowers. The primordial qi flutters and draws them together.

The divine tortoise lies within the Central Upright, slightly askew. If you wish to attain it, you must ask me. Where the One abides, there it rests. Do not merely guard the male but also the female. The One, formless, is most difficult to know. If you do not know the One, all affairs will fail. It is as large as a chicken’s yolk, its color like a sweet orange. When it emerges, it is half; when it enters, it is whole. If you can guard it, all affairs will be accomplished.

The Three Ones are the three palaces of the body: the head, the heart, and the navel. Once you know the abode of the Heavenly and Earthly Parents and the Red Child, the Perfected Ones of the Five Cities and Twelve Towers, you must also know how to ingest the divine elixir, golden liquor, the flowing pearl of the Great Yang, and the Great One. Only then will you become a person of the Three Heavenly Palaces. If you do not ingest these Three Primes, your efforts will be in vain.

First, visualize the Five Beasts: the Azure Dragon, the White Tiger, the Vermilion Bird, and the Dark Warrior—with the Yellow Qilin at the center. These Five Beasts may suddenly transform into mountain forests. Beyond the forests in the four directions stand celestial warriors, tiger guards, and feathered forest officials, eight to each side. Visualize them as vast or narrow as you wish, and you may conceal ten thousand men.

Second, summon the spirits within the body, from head to foot. Visualize the spirits, nurture their roots, circulate their qi, and call out their names. Only then will you attain long life and become a divine immortal.

Third, guard the Earthly One, called the Cinnabar Field. It is luminous white like clouds, its five colors dark and yellow, the dwelling of the Mother of the Dao, within the watery womb.

Fourth, guard the Human One, called the Crimson Palace. Here resides the Southern Culmen Great One, the Red Child, the youth. The moon is to the right, the sun to the left, and the hun and po unite.

Fifth, guard the Heavenly One, called the Purple Palace. It is as large as a mixed chicken’s egg, its nine colors dark and yellow, interwoven with the stars and constellations, the warp and weft of the body.

Sixth, ingest the divine elixir, the essence of the Great Yang. Always begin on the first, seventh, fifteenth, twenty-third, or thirtieth day of the lunar month, or on the half-months of the ninth month, the *jiazi* or *bingwu* days. Enter your chamber, close your eyes, and visualize the red essence of the sun descending into your mouth. Swallow it eighty-one times.

The Perfected One says: Ingesting the essence of the sun inclines you toward Heaven and Earth.

Seventh, ingest the golden liquor, the essence of the mysterious water. Always on the fifteenth day of the lunar month, at midnight, enter your chamber, close your eyes, and visualize the pure white essence of the moon descending into your mouth. Swallow it forty-nine times.

The Perfected One says: Ingesting the essence of the moon is the reason for long life.

Eighth, ingest the descending qi of the mysterious stars, blue-white and cinnabar-yellow. Always at the first watch of the night when stars appear, enter your chamber, close your eyes, and in spring, visualize the blue essence of Jupiter descending into your mouth. Swallow it ninety times. In summer, visualize the red essence of Mars descending into your mouth. Swallow it thirty times. In autumn, visualize the white essence of Venus descending into your mouth. Swallow it seventy times. In winter, visualize the black essence of Mercury descending into your mouth. Swallow it fifty times. On the second day of each of the four seasonal months, visualize the yellow essence of Saturn descending into your mouth. Swallow it twelve times. The four seasonal months are the twelfth, third, sixth, and ninth months. Perform this on the second day of the month, inwardly visualize with focused mind, and you will naturally see the qi.

The Perfected One says: Ingesting the qi of the stars aligns you with Heaven.

Ninth, perform the Great Ultimate’s purple clouds filling the sky, ascending and descending, naturally merging and parting. On the days of the eight solar terms, enter your chamber, close your eyes, and inwardly visualize the purple qi from the Muddy Pellet ascending to Heaven, the red qi from the Crimson Palace ascending to Heaven, and the yellow qi from the Cinnabar Field ascending to Heaven.

chunks.original_text: 须臾，有三童子从天来下。 其一童子衣紫衣，号护脑真人，从紫气中径下，来入泥丸宫，紫气随从还脑门。 其一童子衣赤衣，号护心赤子，从赤气中径来下，入绛宫中，赤气随从还心中。 其一童子衣黄衣，号护藏灵人，从黄气中来下，径入丹田中，黄气随从还脐门。 如是此三童子，补气除恶，练摩血气，勅魂安魄，定心充脉，使光泽流通，津池补满。 良久间，体中休休纳纳，颐颐挹挹，即三童子护身之力。 极念为之，思存三宫心充门开，三童子忽飞还上天，门登闭矣。 真人曰：子欲不忘，审致天童。 天童来下，乘空为马，护子身神，是以成仙。 子不存神，尸魄上言。 其道有九，为之者寿。 钟山真人，传之於禹，与天相保，上升玄府焉。 夏禹授钟山真人食日月星之法 隐之於洞庭之墟。 食日之精，子必长生，缘以上天谒元先。 常以月一日、三日、五日、七日、九日、十五日，日出时至日中食先，念心中有日，日中有玄盖，盖下有小童正赤，赤气徧身中身外九重，思气满头，从顶出，上升天，绕日九重。 咒曰：日君元阳，还归绛宫，与我合德，俱养小童。 因思日精来下，入鼻孔口中，咽之三九，满心中。 心中有三人，左即太一父也，右即玄光母也，中央即赤子小童也。 坐金林玉榻，执玉柈玉杯，杯中玉英神酒，并天芝草见在，食饮之，仍不饥渴而长生矣。 食月之精，可以长生，缘之以上天。 常以十五日夜半时，向月再拜，咒曰：月君元阴，还归丹田，与我合德，俱养小童。 因思月白气黄精来下，入鼻口中，咽之三七而止。 月精托肾根，长生矣。 食星之精，上升太清。 常以日出、哺时、日中、夜半，上念北极太皇星。 咒曰：皇天上帝，太上道君，曾孙小兆某甲好道，愿得长生。 因念星精来下，在两眉之间，流入鼻孔口中，咽之三五，思气满心胆脾中。 脾中有道母，主哺养赤子，即不饥长生矣。 太上洞玄灵宝五符序卷上竟 音释
chunks.translated_text:
In an instant, three celestial youths descend from Heaven. The first youth, clad in purple robes, is called the Brain-Protecting Perfected One; he descends directly from the purple qi and enters the Muddy Pellet Palace, the purple qi following him back to the Gate of the Brain. The second youth, clad in crimson robes, is called the Heart-Protecting Crimson Child; he descends directly from the red qi and enters the Crimson Palace, the red qi following him back to the Heart Center. The third youth, clad in yellow robes, is called the Spirit-Protecting Hidden One; he descends directly from the yellow qi and enters the Cinnabar Field, the yellow qi following him back to the Gate of the Navel. These three celestial youths replenish qi and dispel evil, refine and harmonize blood and qi, command the hun-soul and pacify the po-soul, stabilize the mind and fill the meridians, causing radiance to flow freely and the reservoir of fluids to be replenished. After a long while, the body feels serene and content, tranquil and replete—this is the power of the three celestial youths guarding the body. When the visualization is intensely focused and the three palaces are full and their gates open, the three celestial youths suddenly fly back to Heaven, and the gates close once more.

The Perfected One says: If you wish never to forget, carefully summon the Heavenly Youths. The Heavenly Youths descend, riding emptiness as their steed, to guard your body’s spirits—thus one attains immortality. If you do not visualize the spirits, the corpse and po-soul will speak. This Way has nine practices; those who cultivate them attain longevity. The Perfected One of Bell Mountain transmitted this to Yu, who thereby preserved harmony with Heaven and ascended to the Mysterious Mansion. In summer, Yu received from the Perfected One of Bell Mountain the method of ingesting the essences of the sun, moon, and stars, which he concealed in the wilds of Dongting.

To ingest the essence of the sun is to surely attain long life, thereby ascending to Heaven to pay homage to the Primordial Ancestor. Always on the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and fifteenth days of the month, from sunrise to midday, first visualize the sun, then focus on the sun within your mind. Within the sun is a mysterious canopy, and beneath the canopy stands a small youth, perfectly crimson, his red qi suffusing nine layers within and without the body. Visualize the qi filling your head, then emerging from the crown and ascending to Heaven, circling the sun nine times. Recite the incantation: *"Sun Sovereign, Primordial Yang, return to the Crimson Palace. Unite your virtue with mine, together nurturing the small youth."* Then visualize the solar essence descending and entering your nostrils and mouth; swallow it twenty-seven times until it fills your heart. Within the heart are three figures: to the left is the Great One, the Father; to the right is the Mysterious Radiance, the Mother; and in the center is the Crimson Child. They sit upon a golden grove and jade couch, holding jade plates and jade cups. In the cups are divine wine of jade blossoms and celestial lingzhi grass, which they consume. Thus one neither hungers nor thirsts and attains long life.

To ingest the essence of the moon is to attain long life, thereby ascending to Heaven. Always on the night of the fifteenth day, at midnight, face the moon and bow twice. Recite the incantation: *"Moon Sovereign, Primordial Yin, return to the Cinnabar Field. Unite your virtue with mine, together nurturing the small youth."* Then visualize the moon’s white qi and yellow essence descending and entering your nostrils and mouth; swallow it twenty-one times and stop. The lunar essence anchors to the root of the kidneys—thus one attains long life.

To ingest the essence of the stars is to ascend to the Great Clarity. Always at sunrise, the evening meal hour, midday, and midnight, visualize the Supreme Star of the Northern Pole. Recite the incantation: *"August Heavenly Thearch, Supreme Dao Lord, your humble descendant, so-and-so, loves the Dao and wishes to attain long life."* Then visualize the stellar essence descending and resting between your eyebrows, flowing into your nostrils and mouth; swallow it fifteen times, and visualize the qi filling your heart, gallbladder, and spleen. Within the spleen dwells the Dao Mother, who nourishes the Crimson Child—thus one neither hungers nor attains long life.

*Here ends the first scroll of The Wondrous Scripture of the Five Talismans of the Supreme Mystery of the Numinous Treasure.*

chunks.original_text: 碽古红切。 萐山洽切。 莆方珲切。 太上洞玄灵宝五符序卷中 灵宝服食五芝之精 老君曰：松生千岁，脂凝通神，下入於地，藏姓易名，弃本即大，因根成形，名曰威僖，一字茯苓。 辟兵陆沈，出窈入冥，不饥不渴，日月合并，子能服之，即得长生。 老君曰：苟虱养体，住色还年，一字胡麻，本生大宛，生来万岁，来东度关，留在中土，断绝胡蛮。 含水之精，却风除寒，自名巨胜，摈逐邪奸，服之不息，与世长存。 巨胜、威僖结亲，出胡国，能调和精神，子能服之，故得长生。 老君曰：椒生蜀汉，含气太阴，天地俱生，变化陆沈，故能却湿，邪不敢侵，啖鬼蛊毒，靡有不禁。 子能常服，所欲恣心，世之秘奥，其道甚深，坚藏勿泄，不用万金。 老君曰：姜生太阳，与椒同乡，俱出善土，窈窕山间，坚固不动，以依水泉、含气荧惑，守土本根，背阴向阳，与世常存。 故能辟湿，劫寒就温，除邪斩疾，闭塞鬼门，子能常服，寿若乾坤。 老君曰：菖蒲生泽，附近探渊，下湿之地，浦渎水滨，有生高山，石上结根，一寸九节，是谓灵身。 固得之一，含气万元，故能生人，保养精神，逐水辟湿，厌鬼消患，鬼魅魍魉，远迸幽昏，强祥之属，皆不敢前，服之不休，寿至千千。 乐子长曰：此五物皆可单服，并益气住年，延精定魄，服之不休，与世长存。 故《孝经援神契》曰：姜椒益气，菖蒲益聪，巨胜延年，威僖辟兵。 此即孔丘之秘言，上圣之明旨也。 老君观天合服五芝草丹，留神住年度世长存方。 灵实三天方 乐子长书出文。
chunks.translated_text:
**Phonetic Annotations:**
*Gōng* (碽), ancient pronunciation *hóng*.
*Shà* (萐), pronunciation *qià*.
*Pú* (莆), pronunciation *hūn*.

**The Wondrous Scripture of the Five Talismans of the Supreme Mystery of the Numinous Treasure, Scroll the Middle**

**The Numinous Treasure’s Ingestion of the Essence of the Five Fungi**

The Venerable Lord said: The pine lives a thousand years; its resin congeals to commune with the spirits. Descending into the earth, it conceals its lineage and alters its name, forsaking its origin to grow vast. From its root it takes form, called *Weixi* (威僖), also known as *fuling* (茯苓). It repels weapons and submerges armies, emerging from the profound and entering the obscure. Neither hungering nor thirsting, it unites sun and moon. If one can ingest it, one attains long life.

The Venerable Lord said: The flea nourishes the body, restoring youthful complexion and reversing age. It is called *huma* (胡麻), originally growing in Dawan. Born ten thousand years ago, it came east across the passes, remaining in the Central Land to sever the Hu and barbarian tribes. It embodies the essence of water, dispelling wind and cold. Known also as *jusheng* (巨胜), it expels evil and treachery. Ingesting it without cease, one endures with the world.

*Jusheng* and *Weixi* form kinship, emerging from the Hu lands. They harmonize spirit and essence. If one can ingest them, one thus attains long life.

The Venerable Lord said: Pepper grows in Shu and Han, containing the *qi* of the Great Yin. Born with heaven and earth, it transforms and submerges. Thus it dispels dampness; evil dares not encroach. It devours demonic poisons, none it cannot restrain. If one can ingest it constantly, all desires are sated. This is the world’s arcane mystery, its Dao profound. Guard it firmly, do not reveal it—not for ten thousand gold.

The Venerable Lord said: Ginger grows in the Great Yang, sharing its homeland with pepper. Both emerge from fertile soil, nestled in the secluded mountains. Firm and unyielding, they rely on springs and water. Containing the *qi* of Mars, they guard the earth’s root, turning from yin toward yang, enduring with the world. Thus they dispel dampness, repel cold for warmth, expel evil and sever illness, sealing the demonic gate. If one can ingest them constantly, one’s lifespan matches heaven and earth.

The Venerable Lord said: Sweetflag grows in marshes, near deep pools. In low, damp places—by riverbanks and water’s edge—it also thrives on high mountains, rooting in stone. Nine nodes in an inch: this is called the numinous body. Obtaining even one, it contains the *qi* of ten thousand. Thus it revives people, preserves and nourishes the spirit, dispels water and dampness, suppresses demons and dissolves misfortune. Ghosts, specters, *wangliang*, and baleful spirits flee into dark obscurity; inauspicious omens dare not approach. Ingesting it without cease, one’s lifespan reaches a thousand thousand years.

Master Le Zichang said: These five substances may all be ingested singly. Together, they augment *qi*, preserve youth, extend essence, and stabilize the *po*. Ingesting them without cease, one endures with the world. Thus the *Xiao Jing Yuan Shen Qi* states: Ginger and pepper augment *qi*; sweetflag sharpens hearing; *jusheng* extends years; *Weixi* repels weapons. These are the secret words of Confucius, the luminous decree of the supreme sages.

The Venerable Lord observed heaven and composed the *Five Fungi Elixir*, a method to preserve spirit, sustain years, and endure with the world.

**Numinous Elixir of the Three Heavens Formula**
Recorded by Le Zichang.

chunks.original_text: 巨胜五分、威僖四分、蜀椒一分、乾姜三分、菖蒲三分。 皆取真新好者，精洁治之。 凡五物，以王相日，童男捣药，勿易人也。 各异治，下细筛，五物各万杵。 五物各异置赤杯中，凡五杯，罗列赤案上，露一宿。 明日平旦，乃以神斗分之，合和如法。 和以白蜜，若白饴，后更捣三万杵，丸如梧子。 平旦向日长跪，吞三丸讫，言长生，得所愿。 暮日入，复跪西向，复吞三丸，如旦法以为常。 禁食生鱼、猪肉、韭菜，禁见丧尸、犬猪、产洿。 慎之。 曰此是一剂也。
chunks.translated_text:
**Fivefold Numinous Elixir Formula**

Five parts *jusheng*, four parts *Weixi*, one part Sichuan pepper, three parts dried ginger, and three parts sweetflag. Select only genuine, fresh, and fine specimens, meticulously preparing each. On a day of celestial dominance, have a male virgin grind the ingredients—do not change the person. Process each separately, sift finely, and pound each ten thousand times. Place each in a separate red cup, arranging all five upon a red table, exposed to the open air for one night. At dawn the next day, measure them with the sacred dipper and combine according to method. Blend with white honey or maltose, then pound again thirty thousand times, forming pills the size of parasol seeds. At dawn, face the sun and kneel to swallow three pills, declaring your wish for longevity. At dusk, as the sun sets, kneel facing west and swallow three more, following the dawn method as a regular practice. Avoid raw fish, pork, and Chinese chives; refrain from encountering funeral corpses, dogs, pigs, or childbirth filth. Be vigilant. This constitutes one dose.

chunks.original_text: 若服尽更合，可计药分并合之，多少在意，令周一年，服者乃佳。 至於杵数，可都共益一万杵耳。 合和更梼，是为四万杵也。 甲子建天，癸亥数路，晨昏为期。 慎勿敢忘。 六十一节，天地之常，服之如法。 甲癸为明，甲子建日，服至癸亥日，为一节。 若甲子无建者，满定开亦佳。 服药皆先斋三日，烧香存神，然后即事也。 满六十日，身轻能行； 复六十日，四肢通利； 复六十日，颜色有光； 复六十日，平调腹肠，五脏皆实，凶邪不伤； 复六十日，身体坚强； 复六十日，耳目总明。 此是一岁验也。 复六十日，骨体强梁； 复六十日，手爪有光； 复六十日，影响显彰； 复六十日，精气益长； 复六十日，白发还藏； 复六十日，牙齿坚刚。 此是二岁验也。 复六十日，道德达通； 复六十日，六甲神从； 复六十日，神达身中； 复六十日，志信神行； 复六十日，心开目明； 复六十日，远知四方。 此是三岁验也。 复六十日，瞻视有光； 复六十日，五神不亡； 复六十日，不知饥渴； 复六十日，百神来谒； 复六十日，五藏不竭； 复六十日，能寒能热。 此是四岁验也。 复六十日，能浮能沈； 复六十日，能浅能深； 复六十日，能圆能方； 复六十日，能弱能强； 复六十日，能纵能横； 复六十日，能短能长。 此是五岁验也。 复六十日，能好能丑； 复六十日，能少能老； 复六十日，能大能小； 复六十日，能轻能重； 复六十日，出入无间； 复六十日，行厨在边，位为仙人。 此是六岁验也。 长服不休，与天相倾，变形千化，上升太清。 灵宝巨胜众方 霍林仙人授乐子长，隐於劳山之阴。 巨胜一名胡麻，一名苟虱，一名莫如，一名三光之遗荣，一名天地之更生，一名流朱，一名九变，一名幽昌，一名含腴，一名青襄。 青襄，叶名也。 延年益寿神方 胡麻子，好者择治，去否秽，蒸之如炊，须曝乾复蒸，九曝九蒸乃止。 治下细筛，以白蜜丸，服如鸡子一枚，日三。 又一方云不能丸，服成末三升以为常。 服之一年而色美，身体滑泽； 服之二年，白发返黑； 服之三年，落齿更生； 服之四年，入水不濡； 服之五年，入火不焦； 服之六年，走及奔马。 此药甘香而美，易持难厌，方秘不出，百年一传。 饵胡麻法 取一斛淘洗，去上黑皮，令正白，蒸之一日，曝乾磨之，捣之亦佳。 溉釜中石五斗水，复蒸之，令釜中有石许水，因下甑泻胡麻，置木柈中，悉以石汤沃之。 以麦蘗一斗细铸，纳中酿之，如作糖状。 卒时挤去糟，煎之三分余一分，更置铜器中，浮汤上釜中猛火，无令沸绝。 可丸止当如鸡子者，三丸服之百日，充益肌肉，鬓发皆黑，耳目聪明。 能长服之，命无穷矣。 胡麻膏 胡麻膏一斗，薤头三斤，微火上煎之，令薤焦黄绞去滓，以酒服之，日中一升。 百日以去，服之肌肤充盛，二百日老者更少，三百日延年益寿。 久服神仙也。 真人绝谷方 取巨胜二斗，大椒五升，去黑皮讫，合捣二物下筛。 初服五合，日三。 浆水无在，亦可蜜丸，服如鸡子一枚，日四，渐自不饥。 荒年亦可但服此药，便当绝谷矣。 渴但饮水，勿食他物，食他物便饥也。 能令气力百倍，寒暑不侵，百病悉愈，神仙自致矣。 真人绝谷饵巨胜法 取巨胜一斛，蒸令热气周达，便曝之一日，凡九蒸九曝，合用九日。

Should the dose be exhausted and another prepared, calculate the proportions of the ingredients and combine them at will, ensuring the quantity suffices for a full year—this is most excellent for the practitioner. As for the pounding, increase the total by ten thousand strokes, making the combined pounding forty thousand in all. The celestial stems and earthly branches mark the path: *jiazi* initiates the cycle, *guihai* completes the count, with dawn and dusk as the appointed times. Take heed and never forget.

The sixty-one nodes are the constant of Heaven and Earth; follow the method in taking the pills. *Jia* and *gui* illuminate the way: from the *jiazi* day of establishment to the *guihai* day is one node. If *jiazi* lacks an establishment day, a full and fixed cycle will also suffice. Before taking the medicine, fast for three days, burn incense, and concentrate the spirit; only then proceed. After sixty days, the body feels light and able to walk; another sixty days, the four limbs become unobstructed; another sixty days, the complexion gains radiance; another sixty days, the abdomen and intestines harmonize, the five viscera grow firm, and malevolent influences cannot harm; another sixty days, the body becomes sturdy and strong; another sixty days, the ears and eyes grow wholly clear. These are the verifications of the first year.

After another sixty days, the bones and frame grow robust; another sixty days, the fingernails gleam; another sixty days, signs and portents become manifest; another sixty days, essence and *qi* flourish; another sixty days, white hair retreats; another sixty days, the teeth grow firm and hard. These are the verifications of the second year.

After another sixty days, virtue and the Dao attain thoroughfare; another sixty days, the Six *Jia* spirits follow; another sixty days, the spirit pervades the body; another sixty days, the will and faith move with the spirit; another sixty days, the heart opens and the eyes brighten; another sixty days, distant knowledge of the four directions arises. These are the verifications of the third year.

After another sixty days, the gaze shines with light; another sixty days, the five spirits do not depart; another sixty days, hunger and thirst are unknown; another sixty days, the hundred spirits come to pay homage; another sixty days, the five viscera never deplete; another sixty days, one endures both cold and heat. These are the verifications of the fourth year.

After another sixty days, one can float or sink; another sixty days, move shallow or deep; another sixty days, become round or square; another sixty days, grow weak or strong; another sixty days, extend or contract; another sixty days, shorten or lengthen. These are the verifications of the fifth year.

After another sixty days, one can be fair or foul; another sixty days, young or old; another sixty days, large or small; another sixty days, light or heavy; another sixty days, pass through barriers without hindrance; another sixty days, the traveling kitchen appears at one’s side, and one attains the rank of immortal. These are the verifications of the sixth year.

With unceasing practice, one aligns with Heaven, undergoes a thousand transformations, and ascends to the Great Clarity.

**Divine Treasure Grain-Winning Formula**
Transmitted by Immortal Huolin to Le Zichang, who concealed himself on the northern slopes of Mount Lao.

Grain-winner is also called sesame, *gou shi*, *moru*, "the lingering glory of the Three Luminaries," "the renewal of Heaven and Earth," *liuzhu*, "nine transformations," *youchang*, *hanyu*, and *qingxiang*. *Qingxiang* is the name of its leaf.

**Longevity-Extending Divine Formula**
Select fine sesame seeds, cleanse and remove impurities, steam them as in cooking, then dry in the sun. Repeat the steaming and drying nine times. Grind finely, sift, and form into pills with white honey, taking one the size of a chicken’s egg, three times daily. Another method states that if unable to form pills, take three *sheng* of the powdered medicine as a regular dose. After one year of practice, the complexion becomes beautiful and the body smooth and lustrous; after two years, white hair returns to black; after three years, fallen teeth regrow; after four years, one enters water without getting wet; after five years, one enters fire without burning; after six years, one can run as swiftly as a galloping horse. This medicine is sweet, fragrant, and delightful, easy to maintain and difficult to grow weary of. The formula is secret and rarely transmitted, passed down only once in a hundred years.

**Method for Consuming Sesame**
Take one *hu*, wash thoroughly, remove the black outer skin to reveal pure white, steam for one day, then dry in the sun. Grind or pound finely. Boil five *dou* of stones in a cauldron of water, then steam again, ensuring the cauldron retains a *shi*-worth of water. Place the sesame in a steamer, pour it into a wooden tray, and douse thoroughly with the stone-boiled water. Add one *dou* of finely ground wheat bran, mix, and ferment like sugar. Press out the dregs when done, then reduce the liquid by two-thirds over heat. Transfer to a copper vessel, float it in a cauldron of boiling water over a fierce fire, ensuring it does not cease boiling. Form into pills the size of a chicken’s egg. Taking three pills daily for a hundred days will replenish the flesh, turn the hair and temples black, and sharpen the ears and eyes. With prolonged practice, life knows no end.

**Sesame Paste**
Take one *dou* of sesame paste and three *jin* of scallion bulbs, simmer over a low fire until the scallions turn golden brown, then strain out the dregs. Take with wine, one *sheng* at midday. After a hundred days, the skin and flesh become full and flourishing; after two hundred days, the old grow young again; after three hundred days, one attains longevity. With prolonged practice, one becomes a divine immortal.

**Perfected One’s Grain-Abstention Formula**
Take two *dou* of grain-winner and five *sheng* of large pepper, remove the black skins, then pound and sift together. Initially take five *ge*, three times daily. Water infused with fermented grains may be used, or form into honey pills the size of a chicken’s egg, taking one four times daily. Gradually, hunger ceases. In times of famine, this medicine alone can replace grain. If thirsty, drink water only; consuming other foods will induce hunger. It multiplies strength a hundredfold, renders one immune to cold and heat, cures all illnesses, and naturally leads to immortality.

**Perfected One’s Grain-Abstention Method for Consuming Grain-Winner**
Take one *hu* of grain-winner, steam until the hot *qi* thoroughly permeates, then dry in the sun for one day. Repeat the steaming and drying nine times, requiring nine days in all.
chunks.overlap_context: cording to method. Blend with white honey or maltose, then pound again thirty thousand times, forming pills the size of parasol seeds. At dawn, face the sun and kneel to swallow three pills, declaring your wish for longevity. At dusk, as the sun sets, kneel facing west and swallow three more, following the dawn method as a regular practice. Avoid raw fish, pork, and Chinese chives; refrain from encountering funeral corpses, dogs, pigs, or childbirth filth. Be vigilant. This constitutes one dose.

chunks.original_text: 讫，捣下筛，和以白蜜，服如鸡子一枚，日三，久久食谷自少。 服之百日，百病自愈，洗水不着身； 服之一年，玉女侍卫。 若急用者，亦可一日三蒸三曝，三日凡合九蒸九曝，便可用矣。 天阴者，皆须日出，用一斛，加茯苓三斤，合捣，蜜和，服如上法，得力益速，能补精髓，渐渐自不饥，渴则饮水。 真人轻粮辟毅不食方 巨胜一斗二升，取纯黑者，茯苓二十四两，泽泻八两，治三物万杵，以水 服如弹丸，日三。 遇食可食，无食复取百物食之，无所禁。 出外益体服食方 取麻子五升，温汤渍浸之，令开口去皮。 羊脂二斤，合麻子中仁，微火煎熟，食饱为度。 渴饮水，欲饭自在，更合如前。 麻者，五谷之长，可以知万物，通神明。 七月七日取麻勃一升，真上党人参半斤，合捣并蒸，使气出，徧服一刀圭，无不验矣。 辩菊亿法 菊华与亿华相似，宜以甘苦别之，菊甘而亿苦也。 今所在有菊，但为少耳。 率多生於水侧，缑氏郦县最多耳。 真人曰：日精、更生、周盈、神精、长生，皆一菊也，而根、茎、华、实异名。 其说甚美，而近者服之略无效，正由不得真菊故也。 延年益寿方 春三月甲寅日，日中时采更生，叶也。 夏三月丙寅、壬子日，日中时采周盈，一方云周成。 周盈者，菊之茎也。 秋三月庚寅日，哺时采日精。 日精者，菊之华也。 常以冬十月戊寅日，平旦时采神精。 神精者，一曰神花，一曰神英，菊之实也。 无戊寅者，壬子亦可用也。 冬十一月、十二月壬寅日，日入时采长生。 长生者，菊之根也。 一方云：十一月无壬寅，壬子亦可用也。 一方云：都合五物，皆令阴乾百日，各令二分，治合下筛。 此上诸月，或无采之日，则用戊寅、戊子、戊辰、壬子日也。 春加神精一分，更生二分； 夏加周盈三分，更生二分； 秋加神精一分，日精二分； 冬加日精三分。 常以直成日合之，无用破危日合之也。 一方云：亦尔不用执日，令药神不行。 当於密室中捣，丸用白松脂，大如梧子服之，日三，服后饭。 服之一年，百病皆去，耳聪目明身轻，益气增寿二年。 服之二年，颜色悦泽，气力百倍，白发复黑，齿落更生，增寿三年。 服之三年，山行不避蛇龙，鬼神不逢，兵刃不当，飞鸟不敢过其傍，增寿十三年。 服之四年，通知神明，及与五行，增寿四十年。 服之五年，身生光明，目照昼夜，有光关梁，交节轻身，虽无羽翼，意欲飞行。 服之六年，增寿三百岁。 服之七年，神道欲成，增寿千年。 服之八年，目视千里，耳闻万里，增寿二千年。 服之九年，神成，能为金石，死能复生，增寿三千年。 左青龙，右白虎，黄金为车。 又一方云：春加神精二分，更生二分； 夏加神精一分，周盈二分； 秋加日精二分； 立冬加神精二分； 冬至加神精一分，长生二分。 日吞十丸，旦暮各五。 一方云：秋加神精一分，日精二分。 一方云：春加周盈二分。 饵杏子法 取杏子三斗，去其中两仁者，作汤才沸三四沸，纳杏子汤中，有顷，手摩令皮去，熟治之。 置瓮中待之，清其汁，计度得七八斗。 弃其滓，取一石釜置糠火上，以羊脂四斤摩釜中，令膏尽着釜，热复摩之，令尽四斤脂。 纳汁釜中，炊以糠火，若蚕沙，四五日药成，其色如金，状如小儿哺。
chunks.translated_text:
When finished, pound and sift, then blend with white honey. Take pills the size of a chicken’s egg, three times daily. Over time, grain consumption naturally diminishes. After one hundred days of ingestion, all illnesses spontaneously heal, and water will not cling to the body. After one year, jade maidens attend as guardians.

For urgent use, steam and sun-dry three times daily, completing nine steams and nine dryings in three days before use. On overcast days, wait for the sun to emerge. For one *hu* of grain-winner, add three *jin* of *fuling* (Poria cocos), pound together, blend with honey, and ingest as above. The effects manifest more swiftly, replenishing essence and marrow, gradually eliminating hunger. Thirst may be quenched with water.

**Perfected One’s Light Grain Method for Abstaining from Coarse Food**
Take one *dou* and two *sheng* of grain-winner (pure black), twenty-four *liang* of *fuling*, and eight *liang* of *zexie* (Alisma). Process the three ingredients with ten thousand pestle strokes, then ingest pills the size of a bullet thrice daily. When food is available, eat; when not, consume any of the hundred foods without restriction.

**External Travel Method for Strengthening the Body**
Take five *sheng* of hemp seeds, soak in warm water until they split, then remove the skins. Combine the kernels with two *jin* of sheep fat and simmer over low heat until fully cooked, eating to satiety. Thirst may be quenched with water, and grains may be consumed freely. Prepare anew as before.

Hemp is the chief of the five grains, capable of discerning the myriad things and communing with divine luminaries. On the seventh day of the seventh month, take one *sheng* of hemp pollen and half a *jin* of true Shangdang ginseng, pound together, steam until *qi* emerges, and ingest one *daogui* (scant spoonful). No effect will fail to manifest.

**Discerning Chrysanthemum and *Yi* (Wild Chrysanthemum)**
Chrysanthemum flowers resemble *yi* flowers; distinguish them by taste—chrysanthemum is sweet, while *yi* is bitter. Chrysanthemums grow everywhere, though sparingly, often near water. In Goushi and Lixian, they are most abundant.

The Perfected One states: *Rijing* (Sun Essence), *Gengsheng* (Renewal), *Zhouying* (Fullness of Zhou), *Shenjing* (Divine Essence), and *Changsheng* (Longevity) are all one chrysanthemum, though their roots, stems, flowers, and seeds bear different names. The teachings are most refined, yet recent practitioners ingest them with little effect, precisely because they fail to obtain true chrysanthemum.

**Longevity-Extending Formula**
In spring, on the third month’s *jiayin* day, at noon, gather *Gengsheng* (the leaves). In summer, on the third month’s *bingyin* or *renzi* day, at noon, gather *Zhouying* (some texts say *Zhoucheng*). *Zhouying* is the chrysanthemum stem. In autumn, on the third month’s *gengyin* day, at the evening meal hour, gather *Rijing*. *Rijing* is the chrysanthemum flower. In winter, on the tenth month’s *wuyin* day, at dawn, gather *Shenjing*. *Shenjing* is also called *Shenhua* (Divine Flower) or *Shenying* (Divine Bloom)—the chrysanthemum seed. If no *wuyin* day is available, *renzi* may be used. In the eleventh or twelfth month, on *renyin* day at sunset, gather *Changsheng*. *Changsheng* is the chrysanthemum root. One text states: if no *renyin* day occurs in the eleventh month, *renzi* may be used.

Another text advises: combine all five ingredients, dry in the shade for one hundred days, then process two parts of each and sift. If the specified days for gathering are unavailable in any month, use *wuyin*, *wuzi*, *wuchen*, or *renzi* days instead.

In spring, add one part *Shenjing* and two parts *Gengsheng*; in summer, add three parts *Zhouying* and two parts *Gengsheng*; in autumn, add one part *Shenjing* and two parts *Rijing*; in winter, add three parts *Rijing*. Always compound on *zhicheng* days; never use *pori* or *weiri* days. One text states: do not adhere rigidly to days, lest the medicinal spirit fail to move. Pound in a secluded chamber, form pills with white pine resin, and take them the size of *wutong* seeds thrice daily after meals.

After one year of ingestion, all illnesses vanish, hearing sharpens, vision clarifies, the body lightens, *qi* increases, and lifespan extends by two years. After two years, the complexion glows, strength multiplies a hundredfold, white hair turns black, fallen teeth regrow, and lifespan extends by three years. After three years, one may traverse mountains without fear of serpents or dragons, avoid encounters with ghosts and spirits, evade blades and weapons, and cause birds to dare not fly nearby, extending lifespan by thirteen years. After four years, one gains communion with divine luminaries and the five phases, extending lifespan by forty years. After five years, the body emits radiance, the eyes shine day and night, light bridges barriers, joints become supple, and though wingless, one may fly at will. After six years, lifespan extends by three hundred years. After seven years, the Dao nears completion, extending lifespan by a thousand years. After eight years, one may see a thousand *li* and hear ten thousand *li*, extending lifespan by two thousand years. After nine years, the spirit is perfected, enabling transmutation of metal and stone, resurrection from death, and extending lifespan by three thousand years. A green dragon guards the left, a white tiger the right, and the chariot is wrought of gold.

Another text states: in spring, add two parts *Shenjing* and two parts *Gengsheng*; in summer, add one part *Shenjing* and two parts *Zhouying*; in autumn, add two parts *Rijing*; at the onset of winter, add two parts *Shenjing*; at the winter solstice, add one part *Shenjing* and two parts *Changsheng*. Swallow ten pills daily, five at dawn and five at dusk. One text states: in autumn, add one part *Shenjing* and two parts *Rijing*. Another text states: in spring, add two parts *Zhouying*.

**Method for Ingesting Apricot Seeds**
Take three *dou* of apricot seeds, discarding those with two kernels. Prepare boiling water, then immerse the apricots for a moment, rub to remove the skins, and process thoroughly. Place in a jar, strain the liquid, yielding seven or eight *dou* of juice. Discard the dregs, take a one-*shi* cauldron, place it over a fire of chaff or silkworm droppings, and rub four *jin* of sheep fat into the cauldron until fully absorbed. Heat again and rub in the fat until all four *jin* are exhausted. Pour the juice into the cauldron and simmer over the chaff or silkworm-dropping fire. After four or five days, the medicine is ready, its color like gold, resembling an infant’s chewed food.

chunks.original_text: 服如鸡子黄，日三。 服百日，父母不能识，令人颜色美好。 夏征舒母所服，寿七百年。 乃仙去神方，秘之。 夏禹受真人方 乐子长书出，隐於劳山之阴。 赤箭，一名离母，一名鬼督邮，一名神草，一名独摇，一名当苦，一名胜子，一名鬼箭。 生陈苍、生少室，生上洛尧流山、太山之阳，或诸名山之南，生南阳诸溪涧，或生谷中阴处。 一茎生有节叶，其巅如竹叶，有风不摇。 常以三月采取，尽其根无所去，捣绞取其汁，停置器中，曝乾其滓，乾复纳汁曝乾，治服方寸匕，后食，令人不老。 十日知效，三十日气大至，百日以上身轻，耳目聪明，一年齿发更生。 其茎赤，如弓箭，根似人足跗有指处，但无爪也。 其子似小羊儿。 一曰根如芋魁，其子似芋子，居其傍不与相连，多者十余枚，朝居母西，暮居母东，日中居母下，尽取之。 中央有王，大如指，小者如环之，十二枚，四边各三，是其卫也。 取之先斋戒百日，以酒脯醮其母，於日下乃取之，裹以丹囊，盛常置左腋下。 其王名六甲父母，隐五百人卫，子能隐一人卫。 此药母至死丧生乳者家，药神即去矣。 一曰叶如母指大，指有四赤羽上下竟。 冬夏生，采无时，主治恶鬼精物，蛊毒恶气，中寒热拥肿，起阴益气，肥健轻身，久服延年。 其味苦。 章陆根，味酸有毒，主胸中邪气，涂拥肿，杀精物，练五藏，散水气。 根如人形者有神，生故墟、田间，三月、八月采。 章陆草，一名夜呼，一名荡根，一名当陆，一名苋陆，一名长根，一名商陆草，一名神陆，一名白华，一名逐邪，一名天草，一名逐阴之精。 此草神草也。 去三虫杀伏尸治面□黑益智不忘男女五劳七伤妇人乳产余病带下去赤白皆愈方 够十斤，米三斗，加天门冬，成末一斗，渍章陆六日，便斋服。 五日食灭，二十日谷绝肠肥，财容气息，诸虫皆去，耳目聪明，瘢痕皆灭。 以月宿与鬼日，加丁时，取商陆，服如枣，日三。 道士恒种此药草於静室之园，使人通神。 令人不老长生去三虫治百病毒不能伤人方 取章陆根四十斤，削去上皮，细切之。 以水八斗，於东向灶煎之，令减半，去滓更煎之，令可九服，如梧子一丸。 大良作之，勿令人见。 又一方：取章陆三十斤，正月、二月、九月、十月、十一月、十二月采取，过此不中用。 取章陆，净洗粗切，长二寸许，勿令中风也。 绢囊尽盛，悬屋北六十日，阴燥末治下筛。 方寸匕，水服，日一，先食。 十日见鬼，六十日使鬼取金银宝物，作屋舍，随意所欲。 八十日见千里，百日身能飞行，登风履云，肠化为筋，久服成仙人。 真人长生去三尸延年反白之方 宜服丹光真华之母，宜食浮水玄云之髓，此自然能生，千岁一变，百岁一化，先变后化，天不复害，神鬼无奈何，故可服也，故得生也。 丹光之母者，松脂也。 浮水之髓者，茯苓也。 能伏鬼神，却死更生。 松脂流入地中，千年变为狭苓，茯苓千年化为琥珀，琥珀千年变为丹光，丹光色紫而照人。 丹光千年变为蜚节芝，蜚节芝千年变为浮水之髓，浮水之髓千年化为夜光，夜光千年化为金精，金精千年化为流星，流星千年化为石胆，石胆千年化为金刚，金刚千年化为木威僖芝。 夫金入火不耗，入水益生。
chunks.translated_text:
Take a portion the size of a chicken’s yolk, thrice daily. After a hundred days of ingestion, even one’s parents will fail to recognize them, and their complexion will become radiant. The mother of Xia Zhengshu consumed this and lived seven hundred years before ascending as an immortal—this is a divine formula, to be kept secret.

**The Formula Bestowed upon Yu the Great by the Perfected One**
Recorded in the writings of Le Zichang, concealed on the northern slopes of Mount Lao.

**Red Arrow (赤箭)**
Also called *Limu* (离母), *Guidu You* (鬼督邮), *Divine Herb* (神草), *Solitary Sway* (独摇), *Dangku* (当苦), *Victory Child* (胜子), or *Ghost Arrow* (鬼箭).
It grows in Chen Cang, Mount Shaoshi, the Yaoliu Mountains of Shangluo, the southern slopes of Mount Tai, or the southern faces of renowned mountains, as well as in the streams and ravines of Nanyang or the shady recesses of valleys. A single stem bears nodes and leaves, its tips resembling bamboo leaves, unmoved even by wind. Harvest in the third month, taking the entire root without discarding any part. Pound and press to extract the juice, then set it in a vessel. Dry the dregs in the sun, then reintroduce the juice and dry again. Process and ingest a *fangcun* spoonful after meals to prevent aging. Effects manifest in ten days; after thirty, *qi* surges abundantly; after a hundred, the body lightens, hearing and vision sharpen, and within a year, teeth and hair regenerate. Its stem is red, like a bow and arrow, and its root resembles a human foot with toes but no nails. Its seeds resemble small lambs.

Another account states: the root resembles a taro corm, its seeds like taro kernels, growing beside it without attachment—often more than ten. In the morning, they lie west of the mother; by evening, east; at midday, beneath. Gather them all. At the center is a "king," as thick as a finger, with smaller ones like rings—twelve in total, three on each side, serving as its guards. To harvest, first purify oneself for a hundred days, then offer wine and dried meat to the mother. Under sunlight, gather the seeds, wrap them in a vermilion pouch, and keep it beneath the left armpit. The king is called *Six Jia Parents*, capable of concealing five hundred guards; its children can conceal one. If the mother plant dies in a household where childbirth occurs, the medicinal spirit departs.

Another account states: its leaves are as thick as a thumb, with four red "feathers" extending above and below. It grows year-round, and can be harvested at any time. It governs malevolent ghosts, spectral entities, *gu* toxins, pernicious *qi*, alternating chills and fevers, abscesses, and swelling. It invigorates *yin*, augments *qi*, strengthens the body, and lightens the frame. Prolonged use extends lifespan. Its flavor is bitter.

**Pokeweed Root (章陆根)**
Acrid and toxic, it dispels pathogenic *qi* from the chest, reduces swelling when applied topically, eliminates spectral entities, refines the five viscera, and disperses water *qi*. Roots resembling human forms are imbued with spirit. Harvest from abandoned ruins or fields in the third and eighth months.

**Pokeweed (章陆草)**
Also called *Yehu* (夜呼), *Danggen* (荡根), *Danglu* (当陆), *Xianlu* (苋陆), *Longgen* (长根), *Shanglu Grass* (商陆草), *Divine Reed* (神陆), *White Blossom* (白华), *Dispel Evil* (逐邪), *Heavenly Herb* (天草), or *Expeller of Yin Spirits* (逐阴之精). This is a divine herb.
It expels the Three Worms, slays dormant corpses, treats facial darkening, enhances intelligence, prevents forgetfulness, and cures the Five Taxations, Seven Injuries, women’s postpartum ailments, and red-and-white vaginal discharge. The formula: ten *jin* of pokeweed, three *dou* of rice, and one *dou* of processed *tianmen dong* powder. Soak the pokeweed for six days, then consume while fasting. After five days, hunger vanishes; after twenty, the intestines grow plump, the countenance becomes refined, the breath sweet, all worms depart, hearing and vision sharpen, and scars fade. On days when the moon lodges with ghosts, at the *ding* hour, harvest *shanglu* and ingest a portion the size of a jujube, thrice daily. Daoists cultivate this herb in the gardens of secluded chambers to commune with spirits. It prevents aging, bestows longevity, expels the Three Worms, and cures all poisons, rendering them harmless.

**Formula for Longevity, Expelling the Three Corpses, and Reversing Gray Hair**
One should ingest the mother of *Dan Guang* (丹光) and consume the marrow of *Floating Water* (浮水)—these arise naturally. After a thousand years, they transform; after a hundred, they transmute. First transformation, then transmutation: Heaven can no longer harm, and gods and ghosts are powerless. Thus, they may be ingested, and thus, one attains life.

The mother of *Dan Guang* is pine resin. The marrow of *Floating Water* is *fuling* (茯苓). They subdue ghosts and spirits, avert death, and restore life. Pine resin that seeps into the earth transforms into *xia ling* (狭苓) after a thousand years; *fuling* transmutes into amber after a thousand years; amber becomes *Dan Guang* after a thousand years—*Dan Guang* is purple and luminous. After another thousand years, *Dan Guang* becomes *Fei Jie Zhi* (蜚节芝); *Fei Jie Zhi* becomes the marrow of *Floating Water* after a thousand years; the marrow of *Floating Water* becomes *Ye Guang* (夜光) after a thousand years; *Ye Guang* becomes *Jin Jing* (金精) after a thousand years; *Jin Jing* becomes a shooting star after a thousand years; a shooting star becomes *Shi Dan* (石胆) after a thousand years; *Shi Dan* becomes *Jin Gang* (金刚) after a thousand years; and *Jin Gang* becomes *Mu Wei Xi Zhi* (木威僖芝) after a thousand years. Gold, when cast into fire, does not diminish; when placed in water, it thrives.

chunks.original_text: 夫松脂之变，盖无常形，故能沈沦无方，上升太清。 此飞仙之法，勿传非其人。 方曰：先取松脂、茯苓各十二斤，以水渍茯苓、松脂七日，朝阳去水。 以醇酒二斗，与茯苓合饵之，以曝令乾。 月食一斤，欲不食。 因炼松脂，去苦臭，以火温之，纳茯苓中治合，和以白蜜。 三物合服之，月各一斤，百日身轻，二百日寒热去，三百日风头胸目去，四百日五劳七伤去，五百日腹中寒癖饮症气去，六百日颜色住，七百日面野去，八百日黑发生，九百日灸瘢灭，千日两目明，二千日颜色易，三千日行无迹，四千日诸痕灭，五千日夜视光，六千日肌肉易，七千日皮脉藏，八千日精神强，九千日童子薄，万日形自康，二万日神明通，三万日白日彰，四万日太一迎，五万日坐在立亡。 日三食，慎勿忘，但过万日，仍自纵横，变名易姓，升皇天。 古有黄初平者，正服此药，方成真人。 初平，丹溪人也。 年十五，家使牧羊，有道士见其良谨，便将至金华山石室中，四十余年，忽然不复念家。 其兄初起，行索初平，历年不得。 后见市中有道士，乃问之曰：吾弟牧羊，仍失之四十余年，不知死生所在，幸愿道士为占之。 道士曰：金华山中有一牧羊儿，姓黄，字初平，是卿弟也。 初起闻之，即随道士去，求得弟相见，悲喜语毕，问初平曰：昔羊皆何在？ 初平曰：羊近在山东。 初起往视，了不见羊，但见白石。 还谓初平曰：山东无羊也。 初平曰：羊在耳，但兄自不见之。 便起俱往。 初平言叱，叱羊起，於是白石皆起成羊，数千万头。 初起曰：弟独得仙道如此，吾可学否。 初平曰：唯好道便得耳。 初起便复弃妻子，留就初平，共服松脂、茯苓，至五万日，坐在立亡，行日中无影，有童子之色。 乃俱还乡里，亲戚死亡略尽，乃复还去。 以方教南伯逢，易姓为赤，初起改字为赤鲁斑，初平改字为赤松子。 其后服此药仙者数千人。 赤松子方 七月十六日，去手足爪，除腹中三尸虫矣。 入山终身不食方 用大豆十分、葳蕤三分、泽泻一分、飞英一分、槁本叶半分，凡五物治下筛，和以枣脂，丸如李子，日吞三，食枣二十一枚，可终身无食。 若无枣，常饮玉浆泉。 黄帝受黄轻四物仙方 一曰鸿光，二曰千秋，三曰万岁，四曰慈墨实，合作四物，丸用白松脂，大如鸡子。 服之七年，身寿四万三千岁不死。 长服之，可与天地相守。 黄帝曰：此四物形状何似，可得闻乎？ 黄轻曰：鸿光者，云母也。 千秋者，卷栢也，生於山石之间。 万岁者，泽泻也。 慈墨者，苋实也。 丸以松脂，如鸡子，日一暮服一丸，令人长存，不饥渴。 真人四物却谷散 用茯苓屑三分、乾地黄屑一分、胡麻屑一分、天门冬屑一分、胡麻火熬之，凡四物治合，搜以食蜜，日服方寸匕，美浆水酒为服之。 三十日气力有异，百日倍，一年后气色如云，梦与神游，三年骨腾肉飞。 槐木者，虚星之精，长服之年老更壮，脑不损耗，好颜色。 以十月上巳日，取槐子盛新瓦瓮中，覆一瓦盆，盖之泥，封之三七二十一日，发洗之，其外皮皆去，中子如大豆状。 服之从月一日始，一日服一枚，二日服二枚，三日服三枚，从此至十日，日加一枚，计十日服五十五实，大月服一百六十五，小月则不能以大月计。
